text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
HealthcareService 0..*HealthcareServiceThe details of a healthcare service available at a location
meta
source 0..1uriIdentifies where the resource comes from
Fixed Value: https://annuaire.sante.fr
profile 0..*canonical(StructureDefinition)Profiles this resource claims to conform to
Fixed Value: https://annuaire.sante.gouv.fr/fhir/StructureDefinition/AS-HealthcareService-HealthCareActivity
security 0..0
tag 0..0
implicitRules 0..0
text 0..0
contained 0..0
Slices for extension 1..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
activityType 0..1CodeableConceptExtension
URL: http://interop.esante.gouv.fr/ig/fhir/as03/StructureDefinition/HealthcareService-ActivityType
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J131-CategorieActiviteSanitaireRegulee-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J131-CategorieActiviteSanitaireRegulee-RASS (required): Types d'activités autorisées

authorizationDate 0..1dateDate autorisation
URL: http://interop.esante.gouv.fr/ig/fhir/as03/StructureDefinition/HealthcareService-AuthorizationDate
authorizationNumberARHGOS 1..1stringNuméro autorisation ARGHOS
URL: http://interop.esante.gouv.fr/ig/fhir/as03/StructureDefinition/HealthcareService-AuthorizationNumberARHGOS
implementationPeriod 0..1PeriodExtension
URL: http://interop.esante.gouv.fr/ig/fhir/as03/StructureDefinition/HealthcareService-ImplementationPeriod
deleteAutorisationImplantation 0..1booleanIndicateur suppression sur implantation
URL: http://interop.esante.gouv.fr/ig/fhir/as03/StructureDefinition/HealthcareService-DeleteAutorizationImplantation
dateUpdateActivity 0..1dateDate maj sur activité
URL: http://interop.esante.gouv.fr/ig/fhir/as03/StructureDefinition/HealthcareService-DateUpdateActivity
identifier 0..*IdentifierNuméro autorisation ARGHOS
providedBy 0..1Reference(Organization)Référence vers la structure FINESS ET
category 0..*CodeableConceptBroad category of service being performed or delivered
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J132-ModaliteActivite-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J132-ModaliteActivite-RASS (required): Modalité de l'activité de soins

coding
system 0..1uriIdentity of the terminology system
Fixed Value: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/TRE_R275-ModaliteActivite/FHIR/TRE-R275-ModaliteActivite
type 0..*CodeableConceptType of service that may be delivered or performed
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J133-ActiviteSanitaireRegulee-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J133-ActiviteSanitaireRegulee-RASS (required): Code définissant l'activité de soins autorisée

coding
system 0..1uriIdentity of the terminology system
Fixed Value: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/TRE_R274-ActiviteSanitaireRegulee/FHIR/TRE-R274-ActiviteSanitaireRegulee
specialty 0..0
location 0..0
name 0..0
comment 0..0
extraDetails 0..0
photo 0..0
telecom 0..0
coverageArea 0..0
serviceProvisionCode 0..0
eligibility 0..0
program 0..0
characteristic 0..*CodeableConceptCollection of characteristics (attributes)
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J134-FormeActivite-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J134-FormeActivite-RASS (required): Une forme est un type d’organisation de prise en charge

coding
system 0..1uriIdentity of the terminology system
Fixed Value: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/TRE_R276-FormeActivite/FHIR/TRE-R276-FormeActivite
communication 0..0
referralMethod 0..0
appointmentRequired 0..0
availableTime 0..0
notAvailable 0..0
availabilityExceptions 0..0
endpoint 0..0

Documentation for this format

name: ASHealthcareServiceHealthCareActivity
description: Profil créé à partir de la ressource HealthcareService dans le cadre de l'annuaire santé - décrit les activités sanitaires rattachées aux etablisemments FINESS.

element.short: The details of a healthcare service available at a location
element.definition: The details of a healthcare service available at a location.

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management

element.short: Logical id of this artifact
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.short: Metadata about the resource
element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Version specific identifier
element.definition: The version specific identifier, as it appears in the version portion of the URL. This value changes when the resource is created, updated, or deleted.
element.comment: The server assigns this value, and ignores what the client specifies, except in the case that the server is imposing version integrity on updates/deletes.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: When the resource version last changed
element.definition: When the resource last changed - e.g. when the version changed.
element.comment: This value is always populated except when the resource is first being created. The server / resource manager sets this value; what a client provides is irrelevant. This is equivalent to the HTTP Last-Modified and SHOULD have the same value on a [read](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/http.html#read) interaction.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Identifies where the resource comes from
element.definition: A uri that identifies the source system of the resource. This provides a minimal amount of [Provenance](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/provenance.html#) information that can be used to track or differentiate the source of information in the resource. The source may identify another FHIR server, document, message, database, etc.
element.comment:
In the provenance resource, this corresponds to Provenance.entity.what[x]. The exact use of the source (and the implied Provenance.entity.role) is left to implementer discretion. Only one nominated source is allowed; for additional provenance details, a full Provenance resource should be used. 

This element can be used to indicate where the current master source of a resource that has a canonical URL if the resource is no longer hosted at the canonical URL.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Profiles this resource claims to conform to
element.definition: A list of profiles (references to [StructureDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/structuredefinition.html#) resources) that this resource claims to conform to. The URL is a reference to [StructureDefinition.url](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/structuredefinition-definitions.html#StructureDefinition.url).
element.comment: It is up to the server and/or other infrastructure of policy to determine whether/how these claims are verified and/or updated over time.  The list of profile URLs is a set.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Security Labels applied to this resource
element.definition: Security labels applied to this resource. These tags connect specific resources to the overall security policy and infrastructure.
element.comment: The security labels can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource. The list of security labels is a set. Uniqueness is based the system/code, and version and display are ignored.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Security Labels from the Healthcare Privacy and Security Classification System.

element.short: Tags applied to this resource
element.definition: Tags applied to this resource. Tags are intended to be used to identify and relate resources to process and workflow, and applications are not required to consider the tags when interpreting the meaning of a resource.
element.comment: The tags can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource. The list of tags is a set. Uniqueness is based the system/code, and version and display are ignored.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes that represent various types of tags, commonly workflow-related; e.g. "Needs review by Dr. Jones".

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.short: Language of the resource content
element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Contained, inline Resources
element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

element.short: Extension
element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Optional Extensions Element
element.definition: Optional Extension Element - found in all resources.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Date autorisation
element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Numéro autorisation ARGHOS
element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Optional Extensions Element
element.definition: Optional Extension Element - found in all resources.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Indicateur suppression sur implantation
element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Date maj sur activité
element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the resource that contains them

element.short: Numéro autorisation ARGHOS
element.definition: External identifiers for this item.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Whether this HealthcareService record is in active use
element.definition: This flag is used to mark the record to not be used. This is not used when a center is closed for maintenance, or for holidays, the notAvailable period is to be used for this.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because it may be used to mark that the resource was created in error.
element.meaningWhenMissing: This resource is generally assumed to be active if no value is provided for the active element

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labelled as a modifier because it is a status element that can indicate that a record should not be treated as valid

element.short: Référence vers la structure FINESS ET
element.definition: The organization that provides this healthcare service.
element.comment: Reference vers l'id de la ressource de la structure FINESS ET à laquelle est rattaché cette activité sanitaire

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Broad category of service being performed or delivered
element.definition: Identifies the broad category of service being performed or delivered.
element.comment: Selecting a Service Category then determines the list of relevant service types that can be selected in the primary service type.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Code defined by a terminology system
element.definition: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.
element.comment: Codes may be defined very casually in enumerations, or code lists, up to very formal definitions such as SNOMED CT - see the HL7 v3 Core Principles for more information.  Ordering of codings is undefined and SHALL NOT be used to infer meaning. Generally, at most only one of the coding values will be labeled as UserSelected = true.
element.requirements: Allows for alternative encodings within a code system, and translations to other code systems.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations

Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Identity of the terminology system
element.definition: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.
element.comment: The URI may be an OID (urn:oid:...) or a UUID (urn:uuid:...).  OIDs and UUIDs SHALL be references to the HL7 OID registry. Otherwise, the URI should come from HL7's list of FHIR defined special URIs or it should reference to some definition that establishes the system clearly and unambiguously.
element.requirements: Need to be unambiguous about the source of the definition of the symbol.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Version of the system - if relevant
element.definition: The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured, and when the meaning is not guaranteed to be consistent, the version SHOULD be exchanged.
element.comment: Where the terminology does not clearly define what string should be used to identify code system versions, the recommendation is to use the date (expressed in FHIR date format) on which that version was officially published as the version date.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Symbol in syntax defined by the system
element.definition: A symbol in syntax defined by the system. The symbol may be a predefined code or an expression in a syntax defined by the coding system (e.g. post-coordination).
element.requirements: Need to refer to a particular code in the system.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Representation defined by the system
element.definition: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.
element.requirements: Need to be able to carry a human-readable meaning of the code for readers that do not know  the system.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: C*E.2 - but note this is not well followed

element.short: If this coding was chosen directly by the user
element.definition: Indicates that this coding was chosen by a user directly - e.g. off a pick list of available items (codes or displays).
element.comment: Amongst a set of alternatives, a directly chosen code is the most appropriate starting point for new translations. There is some ambiguity about what exactly 'directly chosen' implies, and trading partner agreement may be needed to clarify the use of this element and its consequences more completely.
element.requirements: This has been identified as a clinical safety criterium - that this exact system/code pair was chosen explicitly, rather than inferred by the system based on some rules or language processing.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:mapsTo dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:hasMap fhir:Coding.userSelected.map. fhir:Coding.userSelected.map a fhir:Map;   fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected\#true a [     fhir:source "true";     fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale\#O   ]

element.short: Plain text representation of the concept
element.definition: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.
element.comment: Very often the text is the same as a displayName of one of the codings.
element.requirements: The codes from the terminologies do not always capture the correct meaning with all the nuances of the human using them, or sometimes there is no appropriate code at all. In these cases, the text is used to capture the full meaning of the source.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: C*E.9. But note many systems use C*E.2 for this

element.short: Specialties handled by the HealthcareService
element.definition: Collection of specialties handled by the service site. This is more of a medical term.

binding.description: A specialty that a healthcare service may provide.

element.short: Location(s) where service may be provided
element.definition: The location(s) where this healthcare service may be provided.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Description of service as presented to a consumer while searching
element.definition: Further description of the service as it would be presented to a consumer while searching.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Additional description and/or any specific issues not covered elsewhere
element.definition: Any additional description of the service and/or any specific issues not covered by the other attributes, which can be displayed as further detail under the serviceName.
element.comment: Would expect that a user would not see this information on a search results, and it would only be available when viewing the complete details of the service.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Extra details about the service that can't be placed in the other fields
element.definition: Extra details about the service that can't be placed in the other fields.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Facilitates quick identification of the service
element.definition: If there is a photo/symbol associated with this HealthcareService, it may be included here to facilitate quick identification of the service in a list.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Contacts related to the healthcare service
element.definition: List of contacts related to this specific healthcare service.
element.comment: If this is empty, then refer to the location's contacts.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Location(s) service is intended for/available to
element.definition: The location(s) that this service is available to (not where the service is provided).
element.comment: The locations referenced by the coverage area can include both specific locations, including areas, and also conceptual domains too (mode = kind), such as a physical area (tri-state area) and some other attribute (covered by Example Care Organization). These types of Locations are often not managed by any specific organization. This could also include generic locations such as "in-home".

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Conditions under which service is available/offered
element.definition: The code(s) that detail the conditions under which the healthcare service is available/offered.
element.comment: The provision means being commissioned by, contractually obliged or financially sourced. Types of costings that may apply to this healthcare service, such if the service may be available for free, some discounts available, or fees apply.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The code(s) that detail the conditions under which the healthcare service is available/offered.

element.short: Specific eligibility requirements required to use the service
element.definition: Does this service have specific eligibility requirements that need to be met in order to use the service?

element.short: Coded value for the eligibility
element.definition: Coded value for the eligibility.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Coded values underwhich a specific service is made available.

element.short: Describes the eligibility conditions for the service
element.definition: Describes the eligibility conditions for the service.
element.comment: The description of service eligibility should, in general, not exceed one or two paragraphs. It should be sufficient for a prospective consumer to determine if they are likely to be eligible or not. Where eligibility requirements and conditions are complex, it may simply be noted that an eligibility assessment is required. Where eligibility is determined by an outside source, such as an Act of Parliament, this should be noted, preferably with a reference to a commonly available copy of the source document such as a web page.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Programs that this service is applicable to
element.definition: Programs that this service is applicable to.
element.comment: Programs are often defined externally to an Organization, commonly by governments; e.g. Home and Community Care Programs, Homeless Program, ….

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Government or local programs that this service applies to.

element.definition: Collection of characteristics (attributes).
element.comment: These could be such things as is wheelchair accessible.

element.short: Code defined by a terminology system
element.definition: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.
element.comment: Codes may be defined very casually in enumerations, or code lists, up to very formal definitions such as SNOMED CT - see the HL7 v3 Core Principles for more information.  Ordering of codings is undefined and SHALL NOT be used to infer meaning. Generally, at most only one of the coding values will be labeled as UserSelected = true.
element.requirements: Allows for alternative encodings within a code system, and translations to other code systems.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Identity of the terminology system
element.definition: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.
element.comment: The URI may be an OID (urn:oid:...) or a UUID (urn:uuid:...).  OIDs and UUIDs SHALL be references to the HL7 OID registry. Otherwise, the URI should come from HL7's list of FHIR defined special URIs or it should reference to some definition that establishes the system clearly and unambiguously.
element.requirements: Need to be unambiguous about the source of the definition of the symbol.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Version of the system - if relevant
element.definition: The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured, and when the meaning is not guaranteed to be consistent, the version SHOULD be exchanged.
element.comment: Where the terminology does not clearly define what string should be used to identify code system versions, the recommendation is to use the date (expressed in FHIR date format) on which that version was officially published as the version date.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Symbol in syntax defined by the system
element.definition: A symbol in syntax defined by the system. The symbol may be a predefined code or an expression in a syntax defined by the coding system (e.g. post-coordination).
element.requirements: Need to refer to a particular code in the system.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Representation defined by the system
element.definition: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.
element.requirements: Need to be able to carry a human-readable meaning of the code for readers that do not know  the system.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: C*E.2 - but note this is not well followed

element.short: If this coding was chosen directly by the user
element.definition: Indicates that this coding was chosen by a user directly - e.g. off a pick list of available items (codes or displays).
element.comment: Amongst a set of alternatives, a directly chosen code is the most appropriate starting point for new translations. There is some ambiguity about what exactly 'directly chosen' implies, and trading partner agreement may be needed to clarify the use of this element and its consequences more completely.
element.requirements: This has been identified as a clinical safety criterium - that this exact system/code pair was chosen explicitly, rather than inferred by the system based on some rules or language processing.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:mapsTo dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:hasMap fhir:Coding.userSelected.map. fhir:Coding.userSelected.map a fhir:Map;   fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected\#true a [     fhir:source "true";     fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale\#O   ]

element.short: Plain text representation of the concept
element.definition: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.
element.comment: Very often the text is the same as a displayName of one of the codings.
element.requirements: The codes from the terminologies do not always capture the correct meaning with all the nuances of the human using them, or sometimes there is no appropriate code at all. In these cases, the text is used to capture the full meaning of the source.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: C*E.9. But note many systems use C*E.2 for this

element.short: The language that this service is offered in
element.definition: Some services are specifically made available in multiple languages, this property permits a directory to declare the languages this is offered in. Typically this is only provided where a service operates in communities with mixed languages used.
element.comment: When using this property it indicates that the service is available with this language, it is not derived from the practitioners, and not all are required to use this language, just that this language is available while scheduling.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Ways that the service accepts referrals
element.definition: Ways that the service accepts referrals, if this is not provided then it is implied that no referral is required.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The methods of referral can be used when referring to a specific HealthCareService resource.

element.short: If an appointment is required for access to this service
element.definition: Indicates whether or not a prospective consumer will require an appointment for a particular service at a site to be provided by the Organization. Indicates if an appointment is required for access to this service.
